For malaria caused by drug-resistant strains
High efficacy, quick effect, and low toxicity in the treatment of malaria

Clinical studies consistent with laboratory results: artemisinin is a new type of anti-malarial drug, exhibiting high efficacy, quick effect and low toxicity

Artemisinin isolated from Artemisia annua in 1972 showed a 100% inhibition rate for Plasmodium (malaria parasite) in mice and monkeys. Clinical studies in 1973 found results consistent with those in the laboratory. In 1981, an international symposium on artemisinin was held in Beijing, sponsored by the World Health Organization. At this conference, its unique chemical structure—a sesquiterpene lactone with a peroxide bridge—was discussed as significant for future drug synthesis. In 1986, artemisinin and later dihydroartemisinin were granted new drug certificates in China. These achievements received the National Invention Award and National Top Ten Science and Technology Achievements Award.

Artemisinin and its derivatives are considered effective tools in the global fight against malaria, saving thousands of lives every day, and contributing significantly to world medicine. Biological: Glycyrrhiza glabra L. var. glandulifera Rega

Geography: Mainly produced in Inner Mongolia, Gansu, Shaanxi, Shanxi, Liaoning, Jilin, Heilongjiang, Hebei, Qinghai, Xinjiang
Properties: About five hundred times the sweetness of cane sugar
Maladies Treated: Decrease of hypophysis frontal lobe function after childbirth
Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) cerebrospinal meningitis

Enhances qi
Clears heat
Rids of toxins
Expels phlegm and stops cough
Stops pain
Synergizes other herbs

Adrenocortical hormone function: Gan cao extract showed mineralocorticoid characteristics. Glycyrrhiza is metabolically converted to glycyrrhetic acid (GA). GA, when incubated in-vitro with adrenal gland cells, increases DHEA production.
Effects on digestive system: anti ulcer, anti convulsion, promotes secretion of insulin, protects liver from toxin.
Anti inflammation
Anti allergy

Anti cancer: Saponins stimulate the immune system and inhibit Epstein-Barr virus expression and possess in-vitro anti-cancer activities. Glycyrrhiza contains quercetin with anticancer effects. Glycyrrhiza lowers serum testosterone levels and correspondingly increases estrogen levels by inducing two enzymes (17-β-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase and aromatase) thus inhibiting prostate cancer cells.
Antivirus and antibacteria: anti HIV, anti HBV, anti amoeba and bacteria
Effect on blood vessels: lowers blood lipids. Both saponins and licoflavones are known to bind to cholesterol and bile acids and have surfactant properties.
Glycyrrhizin is beneficial in chronic viral hepatitis.
Glycyrrhizin is effective in inhibiting Pseudomonas aeruginosa where antibiotic failed.
Glycyrrhizin can reverse or stop the process of liver cirrhosis and early cirrhosis.
Baking or stir frying with honey (zhi gan cao) can improve its function in strengthening the digestive system and immune system.

Gan cao shao is the tips of the root or the fine roots of the herb gan cao. The property is cold. It is used for treating infection, pain in the penis and gonorrhea. Dosage: 1.5 g to 4.5 g in decoction. 
 Zhi gan cao is gan cao coated with honey and baked to dark brown color, used often in tonic. Baking or stir frying with honey (zhi gan cao) can enhance function for strengthening the digestive system and immune system. 
 Qing zhi cao is plain baked gan cao without honey.

gan cao root and rhizome: Glycyrrhizic acid (potassium and calcium salt are the sweet components, content 5–11%)
licorice saponins A3, B2, C2, D3, F3, G2, H2, J2, K, and K2
Flavonoids: licochalcone A, licochalcone B, licoflavone, liquiritin, liquiritigenin, isoliquiritigenin, ononin, 4′,7-dihydroxyflavone
Glycyrrhiza inflata (produced in Gansu): Eight flavonoids: licochalcone A, licochalcone B, licoflavone, liquiritin, liquiritigenin, isoliquiritigenin, ononin, 4′,7-dihydroxyflavone
Three triterpenoids: glycyrrhizic acid, glycyrrhetinic acid, 11-deoxyglycyrrhetinic acid
Hydrolyzed product: Two molecules of glucuronic acid and one molecule 18β-glycyrrhetinic acid
